item.title: Black Ops 7 Co-Op Campaign Camo Challenges—All BO7 Campaign Camos & How To Get Them
item.content:encoded:
Call of Duty has made a big change with Black Ops 7 by introducing a four-player co-op campaign, which, for the first time, has exclusive Camos to unlock.

While earning Camos has long been part of the Call of Duty grind, with exclusive Camos available in both Zombies and Multiplayer, Black Ops 7 adds even more to the mix with the campaign.

If you’re on the hunt to unlock every Camo you possibly can in Black Ops 7, keep this guide handy as it details all of the challenges to tick off.

All Black Ops 7 Campaign Camos & Challenges

There are 12 Camos to unlock for each weapon in Black Ops 7’s co-op campaign, with nine Military Camos and three Special Camos to earn, with Mastery Camos in addition to those.

Military Camos have the same requirements across the board, with some exceptions, while Special Camos have specific challenges to unlock.

Finally, there are also Mastery Camos to earn, which require unlocking all the Camos available on specific guns.

All Military Camo Challenges

There are nine Military Camos to earn in Black Ops 7 Co-Op campaign, with the requirements being the same across all weapons and requiring Critical Kills.

The exceptions, however, are Shotguns, which require Point-Blank Kills, Melees, which just require Kills, and Launchers, which require Kills, destruction of Guild Equipment, or VTOL Destructions.

All of the Military Camops below are available to earn across every weapon in Black Ops 7 Co-Op Campaign, with similar requirements.

All Mastery Camo Challenges

The section below is broken down into specific weapon types to make it easier to navigate.

BO7 Assault Rifle Camo Challenges

BO7 SMG Camo Challenges

BO7 LMG Camo Challenges

BO7 Shotgun Camo Challenges

BO7 Marksman Rifle Camo Challenges

BO7 Sniper Rifle Camo Challenges

BO7 Pistol Camo Challenges

BO7 Launcher Camo Challenges

BO7 Melee Weapon Camo Challenges

Are you planning to unlock all the campaign-exclusive Camos in Black Ops 7? Let us know in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Black Ops 7, check out how to unlock every weapon and Perk, and take a look at the complete list of Achievements and Trophies.

item.title: Unannounced Valve Game Listing Fuels Half-Life 3 Speculation
item.content:encoded:
The hype for a potential Half-Life 3 announcement continues to grow, especially with the knowledge that Valve has an unannounced game under its upcoming releases. The Half-Life 3 hope is higher than ever.

If we discount Half-Life: Alyx (admittedly a phenomenal VR experience), we’ve not had a mainline, multi-platform Half-Life game since 2007. We know Valve and Gabe Newell have explained before that the company doesn’t feel the need to make a sequel, but it’s still one of gaming’s greatest mysteries.

Recent developments are pushing the narrative that Half-Life 3 could finally happen, and an unannounced Valve listing offers another glimmer of hope.

Valve Has An Unannounced Upcoming Release

If you go to Steam, search for any Valve game, then click on the company’s name, you’ll be taken to the main page. From here, a simple scroll down takes you to the company’s existing and upcoming portfolio.

Clicking on ‘Upcoming Releases’ reveals four products:

  • Deadlock.
  • The new Steam Controller.
  • The Steam Frame.
  • The Steam Machine.

All exciting Valve products and releases. However, if you look at the ‘All’ label in the left column, it clearly says 5, yet only 4 products are displayed. This more than likely isn’t an accident, and it suggests Valve has another product or game in the works, but perhaps something so big that Valve doesn’t want to announce it yet—see where we’re going with this?

It wasn’t long ago that a Half-Life 3 trailer was rumored to be in production. If you don’t think this is enough evidence, how about the suggestion that Half-Life 3 is ‘Playable End-to-End‘?

Again, this is speculation, and we’re not saying this is Half-Life 3 confirmed (we wish). However, Alyx shows Valve isn’t afraid to make more Half-Life games, and with the wind very much in the company’s sails right now, it could be full Steam ahead on Half-Life 3.

We’ve had to sit on the Half-Life 2: Episode Two cliffhanger for nearly two decades, and we think it’s about time we finally get at least one final journey to wrap up the most incredible gaming saga.

Stay tuned. What do you think? Is it reasonable to suggest the long-awaited Half-Life 3 announcement is coming? Or are we blowing this out of proportion? Share all your thoughts through the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

For more HL content, be sure to read about Half-Life 3 Allegedly Being Designed to be ‘The Final Chapter’.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Red Dead Redemption Receives ESRB Rating for Current-Gen Consoles
item.content:encoded:
A new ESRB rating has surfaced for Red Dead Redemption on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and Nintendo Switch 2.

All we have been hearing from the Red Dead Redemption franchise in recent days has been RDR2. We were recently informed that the game has become the fourth-best-selling title of all time. We were also told that the game was in doubt due to budget and time issues. Now, new details for the original RDR game have surfaced online.

Red Dead Redemption Rated for PS5, Xbox Series X/S and Switch 2

If you head over to the ESRB website right now and search for Red Dead Redemption, you will see that a new rating has surfaced online for current-gen consoles. The rating mentions “PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch 2, Xbox Series”, which hints at the game releasing for these consoles. The rating, content descriptors, and summary are all the same as previous ratings.

Lately, all the rumors that have been circulating are of a current-gen upgrade for Red Dead Redemption 2, which will see the title released for Nintendo Switch 2, as well as PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X/S, with upgraded visuals and performance. However, instead of RDR2, the rating has surfaced for the original Red Dead Redemption game, which has confused all the players.

In other news, Rockstar Games has delisted Red Dead Redemption 2’s companion app. Additionally, IWGB has issued formal legal claims against Rockstar Games for recent firings. What are your thoughts on Red Dead Redemption receiving a rating for current-gen consoles? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about PlayStation cancelling two $25 million projects, with one of them being God of War developer’s new IP. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: PlayStation 5 and PS5 Pro Will be up to €150 Off on Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
Sony will reportedly reduce the prices of the PlayStation 5 and PS5 Pro by as much as €150 for Black Friday, a new report has revealed.

According to the report, several versions of the PlayStation 5 will see a massive reduction on Black Friday (November 21st), which will include:

  • PS5 console – Standard edition (with disc drive): €449 instead of €549
  • PS5 console – digital edition (without disc drive): €349 instead of €499
  • PS5 Fortnite Flowering Chaos Bundle – Standard Edition: €449 instead of €549
  • PS5 Fortnite Flowering Chaos bundle – Digital Edition: €349 instead of €499
  • PS5 Pro console : €699 instead of €799

As pointed out in the report from Dealabs and author billbil-kun, who has an accurate report of datamining the backend of websites, he believes that additional discounts at other retailers are also likely, so it’s currently unclear if these will be the cheapest.

Are you looking forward to the deals on Black Friday? If so, check back on Insider Gaming as we’ll be bargain hunting for the best deals in tech and gaming for your convenience.

Let us know if you’ve found any deals already in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more PlayStation, check out our articles on the State of Play Japan and PS5’s sales numbers. Make sure to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Black Ops 7 Multiplayer Camo Challenges—All BO7 Multiplayer Camos & How to Get Them
item.content:encoded:
The grind starts all over again in Call of Duty: Black Ops 7, and while you’re pushing to dominate in Multiplayer, there are a host of exclusive Camos to earn—and we’ve got details of them all.

Black Ops 7 has a staggering amount of Camos to unlock in the game, with modes like Zombies having their own batch of exclusives to unlock, and Multiplayer is no different, with Camos available that you can’t get anywhere else.

For a definitive breakdown of all the Camo challenges you need in one place for Black Ops 7 Multiplayer, we’ve got you covered.

All Black Ops 7 Multiplayer Camos & Challenges

All weapons in Black Ops 7 have 12 Camos to unlock, split into nine Military Camos and three Special Camos, with Mastery Camos coming in addition to those.

Unlocking Military Camos in Black Ops 7 Multiplayer requires the same challenges across the board, with some exceptions for specific weapon types, while Special Camos have specific challenges.

Finally, Mastery Camos are unlocked when you have gathered all available Camos for a specific weapon, or group of weapon.

All Military Camo Challenges

There are nine Military Camos to unlock in Black Ops 7 Multiplayer, with the requirements mostly requiring Headshot Kills, though there are some exceptions.

Shotguns require Point-Blank Kills, Sniper Rifles need One-Shot Kills, Launchers require Kills or Scorestreak Destructions, and Melee Weapons require standard Kills.

A breakdown of all the available Military Camos available in Black Ops 7 Multiplayer is shown in the table below.

All Mastery Camo Challenges

The section below is broken down into specific weapon types to make it easier to navigate.

BO7 Assault Rifle Camo Challenges

BO7 SMG Camo Challenges

BO7 LMG Camo Challenges

BO7 Shotgun Camo Challenges

BO7 Marksman Rifle Camo Challenges

BO7 Sniper Rifle Camo Challenges

BO7 Pistol Camo Challenges

BO7 Launcher Camo Challenges

BO7 Melee Weapon Camo Challenges

item.title: God of War Developer’s New IP Was Cancelled After Investing $25 Million
item.content:encoded:
Shuhei Yoshida has revealed that two PlayStation projects were cancelled after costing $25 million each; one of them was a new IP game from the developer of God of War.

We have heard about a few cancelled games in recent times, including the game screenshots for the scrapped God of War multiplayer title, images for Rare’s Everwild, comments on the cancelled Civil War game, and more. Now, Shuhei Yoshida has spoken about PlayStation projects that were cancelled after significant investments.

Two PlayStation Projects Costing $25 Million Each Were Cancelled

During an appearance on the My Perfect Console podcast (via VGC), Shuhei Yoshida opened up about cancelled PlayStation Projects. Yoshida first spoke about the internal game from God of War developer Santa Monica Studios. He confirmed that it was not a God of War game, but a new IP instead, with “a really amazing concept and very interesting gameplay ideas”.

Yoshida revealed that the game was supported for “many years”, but after putting in $25 million, the developers came to him saying, “We have to stop.” He wasn’t able to recall the exact reason for the cancellation, but it was probably because “the team was not able to find the game”. He added that it was a great concept, but “the gameplay didn’t really come to be.”

Shuhei Yoshida then discussed canceling “so many games” that were in early development. With most new games, developers will try a new idea, create a prototype, and if it’s successful, they continue; if not, it has to be reworked or stopped. Hence, early cancellation is not as expensive for them.

However, when projects like the Santa Monica title are progressing well and have had $25 million invested in them, it becomes a “tough decision” to cancel them. But in their case, the developers themselves came and told him, “You know, we probably have to stop.”

There Have Been “Much Bigger Cancellations”

Yoshida then spoke about another game “of the same size” that was cancelled. The cancellation occurred when Yoshida was put in charge of Worldwide Studios, where he was overseeing all the games in development. There were many “great projects” from European studios like London Studios, EyeToy, and eventually PSVR and Media Molecule, you know? Guerrilla Games.

However, there was one “big budget project” that didn’t “have the core game” similar to Santa Monica’s cancelled new IP. He added that these were the two large cancellations, “but these days, $25 million cancellation is nothing special. [There are] much bigger cancellations.”

Yoshida also spoke about how difficult it is to cancel games, even when there is a slight chance for the game to “turn around.” However, at the same time, the financial loss could become larger, and the developers could become tired of working on those titles, he explained. Which is why he tries to communicate during every cancellation, not to get stuck on a project, but rather to do “something different, something new, like brand new. So let’s do the fresh restart’.”

What are your thoughts on the two $25 million projects that PlayStation canceled? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Silent Hill f’s latest update adding a new difficulty, optional skips and more. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Black Ops 7 Zombies Camo Challenges—All BO7 Zombies Camos & How To Get Them
item.content:encoded:
The Camo grind in Call of Duty titles is always a popular pasttime, and Zombie players will be relieved to learn that the process has been made slightly easier in Black Ops 7 compared to its predecessor.

While Black Ops 6 required a total of 2,000 Critical Kills to unlock all Military Camos, that amount has been halved in Black Ops 7. However, there’s still plenty to do, with an additional Special Camo available for each weapon.

Whether you’re on the hunt for all the Camos available in Black Ops 7 from Zombies, or are seeking one in particular, we’ve got you covered with all the challenges to tick off—so bookmark this page for future reference!

All Black Ops 7 Zombies Camos & Challenges

Each weapon in Black Ops 7 has 12 Camos to unlock in Zombies, with nine Military Camos and three Special Camos, with Mastery Camos in addition to those.

Military Camos have the same requirements across all weapons, with some exceptions, while Special Camos have specific challenges that vary per weapon.

Finally, there are also Mastery Camos to earn, which require unlocking all the Camos available on specific guns.

All Military Camo Challenges

There are nine Military Camos to earn in Black Ops 7 Zombies, with the requirements being to secure a set amount of Critical Kills with a weapon.

However, there are some exceptions to certain weapon types, as Shotguns require point-blank kills, while both Launchers and Melee weapons require Eliminations.

Each of these Military Camos is available to earn with every weapon in Black Ops 7 Zombies, with similar requirements.

All Mastery Camo Challenges

The section below is broken down into specific weapon types to make it easier to navigate.

BO7 Assault Rifle Camo Challenges

BO7 SMG Camo Challenges

BO7 LMG Camo Challenges

BO7 Shotgun Camo Challenges

BO7 Marksman Rifle Camo Challenges

BO7 Sniper Rifle Camo Challenges

BO7 Pistol Camo Challenges

BO7 Launcher Camo Challenges

BO7 Melee Weapon Camo Challenges

Which weapon are you planning to unlock all of the Camos for first in Black Ops 7 Zombies? Let us know in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Black Ops 7, check out all the level unlocks available, and find out what Worlds Collide refers to.

item.title: Silent Hill F Update Adds a New Difficulty, Optional Skips and More
item.content:encoded:
A new update is out now for Silent Hill f, which adds a new ‘Casual’ difficulty, optional skips for New Game+, and other fixes.

Silent Hill f was released on September 25, 2025 and has been doing quite well for itself, with sales exceeding one million units. Recently, we saw a Switch and previous-gen port seemingly being confirmed for the title; however, there is no official update on it yet. In the meantime, the developers have released a brand new update for the title, which adds new features and addresses some in-game issues.

Silent Hill f Difficulty Update Biggest Changes

The first new addition with the Silent Hill F Update is the fresh action difficulty, Casual. Players will be able to choose this difficulty when starting a ‘New Game’ as well as trying out New Game+. Players who already have it on Story action difficulty or higher will see the new difficulty become selectable once they reach the game-over screen multiple times.

The next new feature in this update is optional skips for select sections of New Game+. Once players have installed this update, they will find an option to skip upon completing the “Go through the door” objective after solving the mural puzzle in New Game+. The game will then resume at the scene where Hinako awakens in the corridor of the Dark Shrine for the second time with the “Proceed” objective if skipped. 

Players should note that the items that were found in the skipped sections will not be collected. “Thankful to Be Here,” “Grateful for a Worthy Foe,” and “Clear Skies” do not unlock on a playthrough that uses the skip feature. Lastly, this feature will not impact branching paths or endings. Interested readers can check out the system changes and bug fixes in the patch notes below:

All Silent Hill f Update 1.10 Patch Notes—Casual Difficulty, Optional Skips, System Changes and Bug Fixes

New Features 

Added Action Difficulty: Casual 

  • The Casual action difficulty will be playable when starting a game from “New Game” on the main menu or from a New Game+ save file. 
  • For players on the Story action difficulty or higher, the Casual action difficulty will be selectable upon reaching the Gamegamer screen multiple times. 

Added Optional Skip Feature for Select Sections of New Game+ 

Upon completing the “Go through the door” objective after solving the mural puzzle on New Game+, the game displays the option to skip. The game resumes at the scene where Hinako awakens in the corridor of the Dark Shrine for the second time with the “Proceed” objective if skipped. 

  • Items from the skipped sections will not be collected. 
  • “Thankful to Be Here,” “Grateful for a Worthy Foe,” and “Clear Skies” do not unlock on a playthrough that uses the skip feature. 
  • The skip feature does not impact branching paths or endings. 

System Changes 

  • Hinako’s stamina replenishes slightly faster 
  • Unskippable combat encounters are reduced across multiple sections 
  • Fewer enemies are placed across multiple sections 
  • Hinako’s line when an enemy is defeated plays at a slightly later time 
  • Hinako takes slightly less damage on the Hard action difficulty 

Bug Fixes 

  • Fixed bug where Shu duplicates in the cutscene that plays when heading from Sennensugi Shrine to Rinko’s house during the “Head to Rinko’s house” objective 
  • Fixed bug where interaction icons do not display on the hall leading to the room with the naginata during the “Enter the inner room” objective 
  • Fixed bug where the Sakuko-like entity stops moving in combat during the “Defeat the Sakuko-like entity” objective 
  • Fixed bug where the Fog Monster stops moving and halts progress during the “Chase after the Fog Monster” objective 
  • Fixed bugs across multiple levels where events do not progress despite meeting the required conditions 
  • Fixed bugs across multiple levels where specific enemies remain outside of the combat area and cannot be defeated 
  • Fixed bugs across multiple levels where clumps of flesh do not spawn 
  • Fixed bug where some notes from “Sakuko’s Diary” could not be obtained on New Game+ 
  • Fixed bug where Hinako may become unresponsive to player input after dodging 
  • Fixed bug where Hinako dies upon loading an autosave file if Hinako died during an autosave 
  • Fixed bug where the “View Endings” option does not display on the title screen after finishing the first playthrough (may require loading New Game+ data to fix) 
  • Fixed bug where Indirect Lighting and Reflections revert to On during cutscenes even when set to Off in the Graphics menu 
  • Fixed bug where the cursor moves without player input when playing on the controller 
  • *Various other minor bugs have been fixed, including bugs related to audio, hitboxes, text errors, loading, and graphics. 

Silent Hill F update 1.10’s patch notes were revealed through a new Steam post.

In other news, a Microsoft Store leak has revealed the release date for Silent Hill 2 on Xbox. What are your thoughts on Silent Hill f’s latest update, which adds a new difficulty, optional skips, and more? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Far Cry 7’s gameplay images and other information surfacing online. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: ARC Raiders 1.2.0 Update Full Patch Notes—New Map, ARC, and Fixes
item.content:encoded:
ARC Raiders has a fresh new patch ready to be downloaded today, and it introduces the North Line update, the new map (Stella Montis), two new ARC enemies, and much more. It also brings about a series of bug fixes and tweaks that address some of the game’s biggest concerns.

Read on to scope out the full ARC Raiders patch notes for the 1.2.0 update.

ARC Raiders Patch Addresses Desync

One of the core elements addressed in the new ARC Raiders patch is desync, which was causing players to look as though they’d been hit by incoming fire even after getting behind cover. Embark Studios has adjusted this, and it should no longer be a concern for players.

This new patch has also adjusted issues with achievements not unlocking and bullet delay when shooting ARC enemies.

Here are the full patch notes and fixes in the ARC Raiders 1.2.0 update:

Patch Highlights

  • Reduced character movement latency on server to improve the “desync” problem where it looks like you get damaged even after behind cover.
  • Fixed an issue that prevented players from completing quests involving multiple objectives or item collections within a single round.
  • Fixed various achievements not working correctly. Players will need to redo some achievements with only one objective item (e.g. “Destroy the Queen”) while achievements with multiple objectives will only need parts of them completed again.
  • Reduced delay between shooting at ARC and seeing impact effects on the target.
  • Fixed various locations where players could fall through the terrain.

Balance Changes

Items:

Wolfpack

  • Value: From 3,000 to 5,000 Coins
  • Crafting:
    • Before: 2 Refined Explosives + 2 Sensors
    • Now: 3 Refined Explosive + 2 ARC Motion Cores

ARC Motion Core & ARC Circuitry

  • Unlock:
    • Before: Refiner LVL 3
    • Now: Refiner LVL 2
  • Crafting:
    • Before: 6 ARC Alloy
    • Now: 8 ARC Alloy

Launcher Ammo

  • Value: From 100 to 200 Coins (this doubles trader cost for launcher ammo)
  • Crafting (6 ammo):
    • Before: 5 Metal Parts + 1 Crude Explosives
    • Now: 4 Metal Parts + 1 Refined Explosives

Spotter Relay

  • Value: From 5,000 to 2,000 Coins

XP:

Reduced XP per Damage from 3 to 2 for:

  • Bastion
  • Bombardier
  • Rocketeer
  • Leaper

Reduced XP for Looting ARC parts:

  • Bastion: From 500 to 250
  • Bombardier: From 500 to 300

Increased XP for Looting ARC parts:

  • Rocketeer thruster: From 200 to 500
  • Leaper leg: From 200 to 500

Content and Bug Fixes

Achievements

  • Fixed various achievements not working correctly. Players will need to redo some achievements with only one objective item (e.g. “Destroy the Queen”) while achievements with multiple objectives will only need parts of them completed again.

Animation

  • Fixed an issue where weapons were automatically slung when throwing grenades.
  • Fixed an issue where weapons were sometimes hidden when using deployables.
  • Improved camera behavior to prevent clipping through walls and objects while jumping.

ARC

  • Fireball enemies will no longer get stuck on security gates and will pursue the player accordingly.
  • Fixed a bug where the Surveyors fleeing behavior could move it out of playable area.
  • Fixed a bug which caused some enemies to take more fire damage than intended.

Audio

  • Added a System Default option for voice chat input and output devices to follow your operating system’s default.
  • Breathing audio has been adjusted for better balance between players with and without helmets. Breathing sounds are also less audible over distance.
  • Added different audio effects to Scrappy while wearing various helmet cosmetics.

Cosmetics

  • Fixed an issue where party members would initially appear with the base appearance.

Maps

  • The Dam Battlegrounds
    • Fixed locations in The Dam where players could fall through the terrain.
    • Fixed some collision issues on The Dam where players could get stuck.
  • Buried City
    • Fixed locations in Buried City where players could fall through the terrain.
    • Fixed various flickering and clipping issues in Buried City.
    • Fixed some locations where players could get stuck in the subway stations in Buried City.
  • Spaceport
    • Sealed one of the rooms in Spaceport’s Departure Building, making it require breaching to access. The loot inside was adjusted to fit the effort required to enter.
    • Fixed an issue where certain doors could not be breached from the inside in the Launch Tower.
  • Blue Gate
    • Fixed an issue where players could get trapped in the Blue Gate Control Room.
  • Hatches
    • Fixed an issue where successfully entering a raider hatch did not grant immunity to damage and knockbacks.
    • Increased interaction distance for raider hatches.

Miscellaneous

  • Reduced character movement latency on server to improve the “desync” problem where it looks like you get damaged even after behind cover.
  • Reduced delay between shooting at ARC and seeing impact effects on the target.
  • Adjusted blueprint drop rates from Raider Containers.
  • Interacting with Probes, Husks, Raider Caches, etc. now counts towards looting container objectives.
  • Fixed a bug where players would sometimes become unable to perform any actions if they were downed while holding a carriable object and then revived.
  • Fixed an issue where you could not loot or knock out DBNO players on steep slopes.
  • Field crafting selection now stays on the same item after crafting.

Movement

  • Vaulting is now smoother.

UI

  • Added an inventory item menu option for splitting stacks.
  • Removed Thumb Mouse Button from the Escape action in menus to prevent unintended back navigation when that button is bound to Push-to-Talk.
  • Added a confirmation message after submitting a player report to clearly indicate that the report was received.
  • Certain enemy salvage items will no longer auto-assign to Quick Slots when looted (e.g. Wasp Driver), preventing unwanted quick slot fills.
  • Prevent showing blocked Discord users in the social screen when the Discord integration is on.
  • Changed the styling of some UI input hints.

Utility

  • Fixed an issue where the Blaze Grenade Trap could deal more damage then intended.
  • Reduced Tick attachment time for the Anti-Tick Field augment passive from 1 second to 0.5 seconds.
  • Fixed an issue where a prompt would get stuck while fighting off Ticks at the same time as the Anti-Tick Field passive being active.
  • Smoke clouds from items are now always visible at the same range as players.
  • Fixed an issue where the Trigger ‘Nade explosions could bypass the brief invulnerability when entering DBNO, causing instant elimination. Invulnerability now correctly applies on downing.
  • Fixed a bug allowing players to use the Snap Hook to go out of bounds in the Spaceport bunker.

Weapons

  • Fixed an issue where firing while standing close to walls could cause bullets to veer sideways instead of following the crosshair.

Quests

  • Fixed an issue that prevented players from completing quests involving multiple objectives or item collections within a single round.
  • The Greasing Her Palm quest in Spaceport now includes more thrusters that will complete the objective.

What do you think is the most exciting part of this update? Is it the new map, or the ARC enemies? Perhaps you’re eager to get involved with Breaking New Ground and contribute to the community effort to reach Stella Montis? Let me know on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that a Tarkov Twitch Drops campaign is coming
